description: Cluster designed for tagging OSINT artifacts that relate to the taxonomy language found in either the HITRUST Threat Catalogue or the ENISA Threat Taxonomy.
name: OSRS Operational Framewrok - Existential Threat
source: HITRUST Threat Catalogue and the ENISA Threat Taxonomy

values.description: Damage to assets, facilities, and employees due to war or armed conflict.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: HITRUST LIC4 Warfare

values.description: Intentionally setting fire to assets causing damage.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: HITRUST PIC1 Arson

values.description: Disruption leading to adverse operations (i.e., demonstrations, riots, strikes, and protests).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: HITRUST PIC2 Large Events

values.description: Deliberately destroy, damage, or obstruct (something), especially for political or military advantage.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: HITRUST PIC3 Sabotage

values.description: The use of intentionally indiscriminate violence as a means to create terror among masses of people; or fear to achieve a financial, political, religious or ideological aim through physical violence.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: HITRUST PIC4 Terrorism

values.description: Action involving deliberate destruction of or damage to property.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: HITRUST PIC5 Vandalism

values.description: Damage to assets, facilities, and employees due to physical war or armed conflict. (e.g. bombing).
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: HITRUST PIC6 Warfare

values.description: Intentional actions (non-fulfillment or defective fulfillment of personal duties) aimed to cause disruption or damage of IT Assets.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: ENISA Sabotage

values.description: Act of physically damage of IT Assets.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: ENISA Vandalism

values.description: Stealing of information or IT Assets (robbery). This may include the theft of mobile devices, fixed hardware, documents, or storage devices.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: ENISA Theft

values.description: Sharing information with unauthorised entities. Loss of information confidentiality due to intentional human actions.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: ENISA Information Leakage or Sharing

values.description: Unapproved access to facility or location.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: ENISA Unauthorized Physical Access or Unauthorised Entry to Premises

values.description: Actions caused by coercion, extortion or corruption.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: ENISA Coercion, Extortion or Corruption

values.description: Threats of direct impact of warfare activities.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: ENISA Damage from Warfare

values.description: Threats of bombing or other actions that counts as terrorists attacks.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: ENISA Terrorists Attack

values.description: Fraud made by human. May also include fraud by employees.
values.value: OSRS Operational Framework Existential Threat: ENISA Fraud
